course.subject: IELM
course.name: Operations Research I
course.description: Introduction to deterministic optimization modeling and algorithms. Topics include linear programming, dynamic programming, network flows, and some nonlinear models. Application softwares.
course.exclusions: CIVL 2170, IELM 3020, ISOM 3710, PHYS 4059

reviews.author: rubbish999
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge about linear programming, simplex method, transportation, network optimization, dynamic programming and integer programming. Easy to understand even if you skipped all the lectures.

Content after MT is tougher. Spend more time when you are revising for the final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is really boring. I skipped all the lectures except the first few ones. No need to attend the lectures as he will post all the lecture notes before the semester starts, if you are confident enough.

Tutorial sessions will teach some Qs in HW. Not necessary also if you are confident. The materials are really simple though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade

HW 25% + MT 35% + Final 40%

HW: ~90% as i fucked up one of the HWs (20/30), while having full marks in almost all of the other HWs. The mean of each HW is very high so be careful.
MT: 75/100, mean 76.2
Final: 92/100, mean 68
MT is relatively easier than final. Final requires deeper understanding of the course materials. The content after MT is also more difficult. A day is enough for a B. A range requires 2-3 full days of studying.

Mean is ~B. I got an A- anyway. Gotta score higher in mt if you want to get >A- as the mean is so high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy at all.
8 HWs over the whole semester (2 of them are not graded)
MT + Final.
All you need to do is doing the HWs carefully as the exams questions are very very similar to those in HW.
That's it.

reviews.author: legendarychriz
reviews.title: Core Course for Department of IELM
reviews.comment_content:
Basic course for people who enrolled into department of IELM.
It mainly discuss about the most cost-efficient way to deliver goods, or analyse the possible cases when goods are distributed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The tone of the professor is monotonous, I have skipped several lessons because of that. The lesson also starts at 9am, so about 15 people will show up at the lecture.
One thing good about this course is you can follow up the progress easily by go through the notes and ask the TAs, the notes clearly written, and detailed examples are shown.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Homework (25%) + Midterm (35%) + Final (40%)

Grading is extremely good in this course.
Midterm: 90/100 above 0.9 SD mean 76/100
Final : 64/100 mean 68/100

P.S. Final Exam is much more difficult than midterm, midterm requires carefulness, and final exam requires whether you understand what the question is talking about.

I still managed to get a B+.

Most homework are scored in full marks, as the mean is also 1-2 point below full score.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is extremely light in this course, go through the notes, attend tutorials, and you will understand everything. Write a page of cheatsheet before exams, and examples on the cheatsheet, and you will know how to deal with most questions (maybe).

reviews.author: scambret
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm:
- write a linear programming problem

I did not attend every class because slides are very easy to understand. But you have to go to tutorial to learn how to do problems. Because
1) hw are pretty similar to tutorial problems
2) exam questions are similar to tutorial problems
reviews.comment_grading:
25% hm
35% midterm
40% final

Do not miss any hm because professor has allocated a lot of weight for the final mark.
To get A, I have done almost perfect hm
92/100 at midterm (mean=75, sd=15)
93/100 at final (no statistical available)
reviews.comment_workload: Every week you need to work to 2 or more problems to submit every Monday.

reviews.author: Tony_TCH
reviews.comment_content:
Topics covered

Before Midterm:
Linear programming, simplex method, duality theory, sensitivity analysis

After Midterm:
Transportation problems
Network optimization models
Integer programming
Dynamic programming
reviews.comment_teaching:
1) He had all the notes and slides posted so that students can follow.
2) Usually, his slides are illustrated with a bunch of examples and exercises
3) I don't think his lectures are concise enough, sometimes he's just regurgitating for like 5 mins over one concepts, which is boring and hard to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade for this class consist of:
Homework (25%) + Midterm (35%) + Final (40%)

The following information is from the syllabus:

1) Both midterm and final exams are closed-book. But you may carry one piece of double-sided A4-size paper with notes

2) If you miss the midterm exam, weight of the midterm (35%) will NOT be transferred to other components of the course

3) A request for make-up midterm exam must be made BEFORE the exam begins

4) A valid medical certificate is required
The make-up exam will be different from the original one

5) The make-up will be scheduled soon (within 1 or 2 days) after the sickness is over as per the medical certificate

6) If the make-up exam is missed, the student will receive zero score in that exam

Make-up final exam policy

The same rule as above applies except the approval will be handled by ARRO

[To be Updated]
reviews.comment_workload:
There will be in total 6/7 assignments and students will have one week to finish each of them.

[To be Updated]

reviews.author: Hot and Sexy
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamental Topics of Operation Research

Topics Include:
Before Mid-term:
1.Linear Programming
2.Simplex Method
3.Duality Theory and Sensitivity Analysis

After Mid-term:
4.Transportation Problems
5.Network Optimization models
6.Integer Programming

Those topic taught were easy to handle and understand. Yet, it is easy to make mistakes, since those calculations were totally troublesome. It is advisable for you to be more careful when handling those problems.
reviews.comment_teaching: No common, I seldom attend lesson except the first few lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Plan:
Homework 25%
Mid-term 35%
Final 40%
Both Mid-term and Final are closed-book, but you still can bring a piece of double-sided cheat sheet.

You should get nearly full marks in Homework, since the mean of every piece of Homework was extremely high (nearly full marks), meaning that if you miss any piece of Homework or score very low, you will be fallen behind. I got nearly full marks in this aspect.

Mid-term is extremely easy as long as you understand all the questions appeared in the Homework and cautious enough. The mean was quite high, 73/100, sd 17.xx, as I remember, and I got 8x.

Final was quite difficult, in my opinion. Questions were quite complicated. The result of the exam has not been announced, and I have no idea on my marks.

I got B anyway.
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively low.
1 assignment every week and have to be handed in during lesson.

reviews.author: ATKmode
reviews.comment_content:
主要教Operation Research的基本計算，雖然有一些經濟上的解釋，不過基本上很少講也不太需要理解
只要tutorial好好上，基本上沒什麼應付不了的
Midterm前比較多東西記，但是比較簡單
Midterm后的東西比較複雜，需要理解
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授的英文不錯，雖然是內地教授但還是聽得懂
就是有點無聊，Lecture主要教怎麼算，或者經濟解析
Tutorial主要教怎麼做作業，基本上會出和作業一樣的題型來教，還能發Email請教Tutor作業
reviews.comment_grading:
非常好Grade
Midterm高半個SD
Final沒有出分數，估計過Mean
Assignment幾乎全部滿分（有source）
最後B
Midterm Final只出功課那種計算題。
reviews.comment_workload:
考試可以帶A4 both sided的cheat sheet
大概有6~7份assigment 全部是計算題，上tutor或者照抄tutorial notes基本滿分。
